p: About 400 g of P. malayana leaves were collected from six different areas of Indonesia for the purpose of validation. The leaves were cleaned and dried for seven days at ambient temperature. After that, the leaves were ground into powder utilizing a universal cutting mill (Fritsch, Germany) and preserved in a freezer having the temperature of −80 °C [ 22, 31]. The crude extracts were prepared with 100% methanol after sonication for 30 min. AGI activity was determined for each extract, and FTIR analysis was used to evaluate the inhibitory activity of α-glucosidase utilizing multivariate data analysis [ 22, 30].
